review: Really easy to install.  There is a lot to choose from and the clarity is amazing.  I have Chromecast but it would stutter everything but Netflix.  No buffering. I currently have NetFlix and HuluPlus and that seems to fit the bill for all of my viewing needs.  I will probably upgrade my Prime too.  With this, I do not need cable anymore.  I am very happy so far.

review: I haven't had my Amazon Fire TV a month yet, which makes it too soon to give it 5 stars. But so far, I am really enjoying it. If you are a Prime member and actually watch the videos, then it is worth getting. I use password feature. For those of us who get a little trigger happy and like to push buttons, it makes you take a breath and make sure your not doing something you did not intend. If you are watching a series (with Prime), it will automatically play the next episode... I love that. If you have to leave it and forget to turn it off, a screen saver will come up - which is also a good thing (especially for those with plasmas). When I go back to watching something it starts where I left off. Haven't really used the Prime Music part much, but it seemed ok too. Have not played any games on it yet. Have a couple of apps with it, I've been happy with those. Only used the voice thing once, but it worked fine. Enjoy!
author: Loo
